description: Dive into "Capturing Colmar: A Photographer's Dream" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Capturing Colmar: A Photographer's Dream

places.generalDescription: The Unterlinden Museum, located in a former 13th-century Dominican convent, is a captivating blend of religious and local history alongside an impressive art collection. One of its most renowned pieces is the Isenheim Altarpiece by Matthias Grunewald, known for its powerful depiction of Jesus' story and its historical significance as a source of solace for medieval hospital patients.

sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Colmar, France (+Map & Tips for Your Visit)
Discover Colmar France: A Real Life Fairytale Village
One Perfect Day in Colmar: Things to Know on Your First Visit

places.name: Unterlinden Museum

reviews.text: It was very positive... I was more keen this time on contemporary art works which are breathtaking and it invited me to humility... Yes, they speak much beyond what I understand now..

Try to came by here if you happen go to Colmar or the area around. The museum with remarkable architectuur and art collections. Is not as big as Louvre but it is worth a visit. Price ticket for adults ‚Ç¨13 per person.
Mid-sized museum with local artefacts, a famous painting (the Isenheim Altarpiece), and some modern art.

places.generalDescription: La Petite Venise in Colmar, France is a charming area known for its canals and historic buildings. The fisherman's section features half-timbered 16th- and 17th-century buildings along the Quai de la Poisonnerie, with the River Lauch flowing through. Swans gracefully float on the water while weeping willows line the banks, creating a picturesque scene reminiscent of a fairy tale illustration.

sources.snippet: Little Venice (La Petite Venise) - Arguably, the prettiest part of the old town is the small river right in the middle, known as Little Venice. This shallow stream of water flows past brightly painted houses and under beautiful bridges, making it a must-see on any trip to Colmar. Walk along the river or sit down at one of the many cafes, taking in the beautiful and vibrant atmosphere.
sources.shortName: Best things and photospots in Colmar France, where to go where to stay everything you need to know

sources.snippet: Discover the hidden secrets of Colmar from a local's perspective while visiting iconic landmarks such as La petite Venise, the covered market, Maison des T√™tes, and the famous Maison Pfister. Don't miss out on this opportunity to upgrade your insta feed and create unforgettable memories. Book now and let us show you the best of Colmar!
sources.shortName: Explore the Instaworthy Spots of Colmar with a Local

sources.snippet: But there‚Äôs more to Colmar than just the most photographed street in the La Petite Venise district that you see in all travel brochures and on social media‚Ä¶ The entire city center is gorgeous, with lively squares and a labyrinth of pretty streets lined with caf√©s and shops selling local specialties.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Colmar, France (+Map & Tips for Your Visit)

sources.snippet: One of the most famous spots in Colmar is Little Venice (or La Petite Venise). Here, the houses along the canal resemble Venice, Italy, and this area was once a place for people to trade fish and wine. Today, it‚Äôs perfect for a relaxing stroll, a peaceful boat ride, or a nice glass of Riesling.
sources.shortName: Discover Colmar France: A Real Life Fairytale Village

sources.snippet: Explore the charming Petite Venise, lined with colorful half-timbered houses along the canals. Discover the historic Rue des Tanneurs, where artisan workshops await. Admire the ornate Maison des T√™tes building and the stunning Gothic architecture of the √âglise Saint-Martin cathedral.
sources.shortName: Capture The Most Photogenic Spots With A Local

sources.snippet: A highlight and top Instagram spot in Colmar is around Petite Venise. This is along Quai de la Poissonnerie (a path) and has some of the most picturesque architecture. Along this path you may also be able to capture a tourist train going past that can complement your photos.
sources.shortName: 8 Best Instagram and Photography Spots in Colmar

sources.snippet: Little Venice (fr. La Petite Venise) is a small part of a district called Krutenau in Colmar. And it‚Äôs located very close to the historic city center. Here, you can find some of the most picturesque views in Colmar.
sources.shortName: 21 Things to Do in Colmar, France to Make a Perfect Day Trip

sources.snippet: From there, it was just a short walk up towards the most famous view of Colmar, La Petite Venise ‚Äì but not before walking along this adorable street to get there.
sources.shortName: A Photo Tour Of Colmar, France‚Äôs Fairytale Town

places.name: La Petite Venise

reviews.text: We were very happy to travel here. The people are very friendly, the air is fresh, the environment is beautiful, and the travel experience was amazing. It's not overly commercialized. In early April, there aren't too many tourists, and with the great spring weather, it's easy to fall in love with this place without even realizing it. This romantic spot has, for hundreds of years, attracted many scholars, writers, and painters who came here in search of creative inspiration.

Colmar is a truly beautiful town - I absolutely loved it.
It's a perfect place for walking, relaxing, and simply soaking in the atmosphere.

You can enjoy some great local cafes and restaurants, or just sit by the canal and take in the refreshing vibe of the town.

Between the charming old buildings and peaceful natural surroundings, it offers a lovely and balanced experience. I think 3 days is enough to explore Colmar, but honestly, I wouldn't mind staying for 7‚Äì10 days - especially if you plan to visit nearby villages or cities in France or even Germany, since it's so close to the border.

Highly recommended for anyone looking for a peaceful and picturesque getaway.

Colmar is a magical fairy-tale town that you will be thrilled by. Parking is well organized, there are several marked parking lots and you can drive very close to the canal and park in the square, it was very busy, but we found a place. About 100 meters away is the canal restaurant, where you board the boat, tickets are sold in the restaurant. We waited about 20 minutes for our boat and so we had prosecco. I definitely recommend the cruise, it is a beautiful experience. You sail past historic houses lined with restaurants to the old market, which is definitely worth a visit, you can taste local specialties there. Behind the market, the boat turns and you sail back and further towards the historic bridge to the beautiful romantic corners of Colmar, like in Monet's paintings.

places.address: Quai de la Poissonnerie, 68000 Colmar, France

places.generalDescription: Maison Pfister is a stunning Renaissance town mansion located in Colmar, originally built in 1537 for Ludwig Scherer. The house is now named after Francois-Xavier Pfister, who acquired it in 1841. Colmar serves as an ideal base for exploring the medieval wine villages and towns nestled among the picturesque vineyards of the Vosges mountains.

sources.snippet: Discover the hidden secrets of Colmar from a local's perspective while visiting iconic landmarks such as La petite Venise, the covered market, Maison des T√™tes, and the famous Maison Pfister. Don't miss out on this opportunity to upgrade your insta feed and create unforgettable memories. Book now and let us show you the best of Colmar!
sources.shortName: Explore the Instaworthy Spots of Colmar with a Local

sources.snippet: The Pfister House was built in 1537 as the first Renaissance building in Colmar. Like the rest of the city, it looks like taken from a fairy-tale with a staircase highlighted in construction and wooden galleries. The building was decorated with paintings representing biblical scenes.
sources.shortName: 21 Things to Do in Colmar, France to Make a Perfect Day Trip

sources.snippet: As the local guide leads the small group through the charming streets, they‚Äôll uncover the stories behind Colmar‚Äôs most famous sites, like the Maison Pfister, a stunning 16th-century half-timbered house, and the Ko√Øfhus, a former commercial warehouse that now houses a museum.
sources.shortName: Capture The Most Photogenic Spots With A Local

sources.snippet: Maison Pfister is one of the most famous buildings in Colmar. Its ornate Renaissance-style fa√ßade makes for a stunning photo. You can take this photo from different angles, but I highly recommend taking a vertical shot from the side of the building.
sources.shortName: 18 Amazing Colmar Instagram Spots (A Local‚Äôs Guide)
Discover Colmar France: A Real Life Fairytale Village

places.name: Maison Pfister

reviews.text:
I came here on a recommendation I received in Strasbourg! A lovely lady spotted my Studio Ghibli tattoos and informed me that the inspiration for the initial town came from Colmar, so I just had to detour on my road trip to see for myself.

It's SO BEAUTIFUL, and the inspiration is very evident. The area itself had lovely street music going on and since I visited a week and a half before Easter it was beautifully decorated. Tons of markets in the area to explore.

Stepping into a fairytale! Built in the 1500s, this medieval-looking Alsatian house was commissioned by a wealthy hatter-just like Sophie, a hatter herself-though much poorer, of course... With its whimsical turrets, wooden balconies, and storybook charm, this place looks straight out of a magical adventure.
Can you picture Howl landing here with Calcifer's magic?

#HowlsMovingCastle #GhibliVibes #MedievalFantasy #FairytaleTravel #AlsatianTown
Old Pfister House, there are nice details on the building facade

places.generalDescription: Brasserie des Tanneurs is a charming country-style restaurant in Colmar, known for its traditional Alsatian dishes and whimsical vibe. It consists of two family-friendly restaurants, Brasserie des Tanneurs and Le Petit Tanneur, offering a cozy atmosphere and a kid-friendly menu. The rustic wooden decor makes it an ideal spot for capturing Instagram-worthy photos all year round.

sources.snippet: The restaurant Brasserie des Tanneurs has a very pretty storefront that you might want to capture for Instagram. The interior is also very cute with the wooden traditional decor!. It‚Äôs very popular among tourists so if you want to eat here, better book in advance or arrive early.
sources.shortName: The Best Instagram Spots in Colmar

sources.snippet: Brasserie des Tanneurs is a must-visit spot for foodies and Instagrammers alike. With its charming decorations, it‚Äôs the perfect place to snap a photo while enjoying some delicious Alsatian cuisine. Of the photos I have of Brasserie des Tanneurs, the one above is my favorite.
sources.shortName: 18 Amazing Colmar Instagram Spots (A Local‚Äôs Guide)

places.name: Brasserie des Tanneurs

reviews.text: The food was very good. üòä both like the Alsace typical food and French. Sourcrow was very good and pork meat üçñ tasty ü§§. The fromage a la ch√®vre so exquisite

Very busy restaurant, with tables crammed together. We felt rushed and staff were under pressure coping with customers inside and the queues outside.
To be honest, food was ordinary with tarte flambes lacking in flavour.
I ate asortment of alsatian sausages with sauerkraut and potato. It was as good as it can be. Sauerkraut was fine and sausages were also tasty.

places.generalDescription: The Mus√©e Bartholdi, located in the heart of Colmar, celebrates the life and works of Auguste Bartholdi, the renowned sculptor behind the Statue of Liberty. This house-museum displays a variety of his works and features preparatory models for some of his most famous pieces. Visitors can explore three levels showcasing exhibits such as preparatory models for Bartholdi's creations, including an ear model for the Statue of Liberty.

sources.shortName: 21 Things to Do in Colmar, France to Make a Perfect Day Trip

places.name: Mus√©e Bartholdi

reviews.text:
Great little museum giving a fascinating insight into the famous son of Colmar -  "Auguste Bartholdi". Naturally there's a big focus on his most famous work "The Statue of Liberty" and there are many exciting details and photos of it's design, construction and transport to America.

The house itself is the birthplace of Bartholdi and is very well kept in the original period style. It has a great collection of pieces and samples and is not too big or overwhelming for children. We had a great time and the whole family learned alot.
Small museum, a few pieces from Bartholdi and quite a lot information on Statue of Liberty can be seen, entrance is 5 Euros

Cute little museum about the person behind the statue of liberty. Worth a visit. Museum not that big. Beautiful museum with so much to see regarding Bartholdi's work. It is definitely worth a visit to see the work of this diverse artist

places.generalDescription: Coll√©giale Saint-Martin de Colmar is a grand Roman Catholic church that stands out with its Gothic architecture and medieval statues. Situated in the heart of the Old Town, it boasts a picturesque canal leading to its rear from Quartier des Tanneurs. The church, completed in the mid-1300s, features typical Gothic style with arched ceilings and stunning stained glass windows. Its intricate design includes a soaring Gothic choir and ornate decorative details.

sources.snippet: The centerpiece of the center is the Collegiale Saint-Martin church. This Gothic church dates from the 14th century and is built in a beautiful Gothic style. The church is beautifully decorated and should not be missed.
sources.shortName: Colmar France, the best photo spots and where we stayed

places.name: Coll√©giale Saint-Martin de Colmar

reviews.text:
One of the beautiful churches I've seen. The peace that you feel when you're inside is surreal. The church is very well kept, although it's still under renovation, you can still see most of the old beauty.
The church during the golden hour were beautiful the walls and the structure of the building were glowing in the sunlight.

It is beautiful cathedral. The inner space is magic, with so strong atmosphere, and the outside is so impressive. The entrance is free but you can voluntarily give a few coins to the person standing in front of the door. What I would like to highlight is really pleasant fact that they take really good care of the building, it is all well-maintained and clean, leaving almost no black spots on it.

This is a large Gothic style church situated in the historic city centre of Colmar that I quite enjoyed seeing recently.

Historically, it seems there have been church buildings at this location since at least 1000 AD. However, the building you see today was constructed between 1234 and 1365.

It is a fine example of Alsace Gothic architecture from the Middle Ages and there are some nice things to see inside including original stained glass windows, choir ambulatory, altarpieces and Baroque era organ.

Worth 10 minutes of your time to browse the interior and a few more looking over the facade, towers, portals and other Gothic aspects of the exterior as well.

places.address: 18 Pl. de la Cath√©drale, 68000 Colmar, France

places.generalDescription: Located in the heart of the old city, Place de l'Ancienne Douane is a bustling square surrounded by 50 stalls on both sides of the River Lauch. The market offers a wide array of local craft beer, hand-painted ornaments, and unique German Christmas pyramids. The area is rich in history and architectural beauty, with buildings dating back at least 400 years. Nearby attractions include the Quartier des Tanneurs and the famous Schwendi Fountain designed by Bartholdi.

sources.snippet: Place de l‚ÄôAncienne Douane is a popular square in the heart of Colmar. It‚Äôs surrounded by beautiful old buildings, and, at the center, you‚Äôll find Fontaine Schwendi. But the real highlight is the half-timbered houses shown in the photo above.
sources.shortName: 18 Amazing Colmar Instagram Spots (A Local‚Äôs Guide)

sources.snippet: Around Place de l‚ÄôAncienne Douane is this spot with a little water feature and trees. The trees can help with your framing. This spot is quite nice to visit around twilight.
sources.shortName: 8 Best Instagram and Photography Spots in Colmar

places.name: Place de l'Ancienne Douane

reviews.text: It's 3rd time visiting this village, it doesn't change too much, still beautiful and lovely
Beautiful colonial building with a gorgeous view of the Atlantic. The location is also suitable for private meetings and access is easy. The history of the place takes you back in time.

The Ko√Øfhus or the former customs house. Constructed from 1433 to 1480. Two adjoining buildings were added in the 16th century. The condition of the building was in the 19th century so worrying that a demolition was envisaged. But the project was cancelled and restorations took place from 1895 to 1898. The turret and the glazed tiles came from that time. The last renovation in 2002 was to repair the sandstone balustrade in a Renaissance style which was removed in 1976.

places.address: Pl. de l'Ancienne Douane, 68000 Colmar, France

places.generalDescription: Colmar Christmas Market is a must-visit destination in the Alsace region, offering a picturesque setting with its medieval village charm and colorful half-timbered houses. Situated near the border of France and Germany, it embodies the best of both countries. Accessible by train or car, it's also convenient to fly into Paris CDG if you're planning a visit specifically for the Christmas markets.

sources.snippet: By far, the biggest event you‚Äôll hear about in Colmar is the Christmas Market. During December, Colmar truly gets into the Christmas spirit. The city is sparkling with beautiful lights‚Äìmaking this fairytale village even more like a fairytale.
sources.shortName: Discover Colmar France: A Real Life Fairytale Village

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre visiting Colmar during the holiday season, then you have to visit the Christmas market. It‚Äôs impossible not to. This little town transforms into a winter wonderland.
sources.shortName: 18 Amazing Colmar Instagram Spots (A Local‚Äôs Guide)

places.name: Colmar Christmas Market

reviews.text:
Truly beautiful and enchanting Christmas market. Its great to take pictures but also for gourmet people. It is also very big and you might get easily lost.
I loved the crazy amount of local food and drink specialities you could buy. The little museums are also worth a visit.

The only negative aspects are the crowds. The market is very popular and there are way too many people cramped in those small alleyways.
Also I had to park 2km away from the market in a residential area, since every car park was full.
The most beautiful and fairytale style city at Christmas. If I could I would give 10 stars. The vibe, the look of the city is out of this world. It should be on the bucket list of every person.

We made a day trip to Colmar during our recent stay in Strasbourg and enjoyed the charming Christmas Market scene held around the city centre. The annual Christmas Market is held during Advent (late November until 29 December each year. There are signs from Colmar Central Station clearly pointing the way to the city centre and main market squares, the walk is around 12-15 minutes. The market is up and running from around 10am each morning.

The Christmas Market in Colmar is spread out over a handful of public squares where you find traditional Christmas market stalls selling hot wine, seasonal food, holiday ornamentations, gifts and related items. Everything blends in nicely with the medieval appearance of the city centre, creating great atmosphere to enjoy the holiday season. It was also nice seeing the larger scale Christmas trees and tall Noel Pyramid and other Christmas themed entertainment for families at Place Rapp. All in all, we spent around 5 hours enjoying the market and sightseeing before catching train back to Strasbourg in the mid afternoon.

places.address: Pl. des 6 Montagnes Noires, 68000 Colmar, France

places.generalDescription: The Dominican Church in Colmar is a restored 14th-century Gothic church that houses remarkable Alsatian artworks. Construction began in 1283, and despite necessary renovations over the years, the church retains its fascinating history. Notable pieces include revolutionary painter Grunewald's artwork and Martin Schongauer's famous 'Madonna of the Rose Bush.' The stained-glass windows are a must-see for art enthusiasts, depicting religious scenes.

sources.shortName: 21 Things to Do in Colmar, France to Make a Perfect Day Trip

places.name: √âglise des Dominicains

reviews.text: Too crowded in high season.  But for a good reason. Annecy could compete with the best of France's flowering villages, which is remarkable given that it is a sizable city. Driving into and out of town in summer might cost you an hour each.
Big church locate in the middle of the city near saint martin church .Entre fee for2‚Ç¨ /person but inside nothing to see much just a drawing picture of Madona of the rose bush and a little

We were there in December, so the Christmas Village crowds were at a high. The church was such a beautiful structure, but too crowded to get inside. This village redeemed my feelings about France (not a fan of Paris) with only one rude restaurant owner who clearly did not like Americans. The rest of the folks were so sweet and cheery.

places.generalDescription: √âglise Saint-Matthieu is a Protestant church in Colmar, France, with a rich history dating back to 1292. The church is adorned with vintage oil paintings and houses a huge pipe organ. In 1989, it became an international festival venue under the artistic direction of renowned Russian violinist Vladimir Spivakov. Over the years, the festival has hosted numerous concerts featuring great musicians and orchestras at this historic site.

sources.snippet: This church has an austere style similar to the Dominican Church. It was constructed by the Franciscans beginning in 1292 and completed over a century later. When the Franciscan monastery closed in 1543, the building was converted into a hospital.
sources.shortName: 13 Top-Rated Tourist Attractions in Colmar

places.name: √âglise Saint-Matthieu de Colmar

reviews.text: Really cool experience. Everything is so well presented. Absolutely breathtaking church. Must see!!

St Matthew's Church is a former Franciscan church whose nave was built in 1292. After a long history, in 1937 the choir was returned to the Protestants. What I can appreciate is that it is not only used as a place or worship. Thanks to its amazing acoustics, concerts from the yearly International music festival of Colmar take place there.
Don't count on the posted opening hours being honoured. The church was closed at 4pm on a Saturday.

places.generalDescription: Quartier des Tanneurs, also known as the Tanners Quarter, is a charming area located near La Petite Venise and Place de l'Ancienne-Douane. This picturesque neighborhood is perfect for leisurely strolls, offering visitors the chance to explore quaint bistros and shops while admiring the local architecture. One of its notable attractions is the Schwendi Fountain, designed by Bartholdi, the sculptor of the Statue of Liberty.

sources.snippet: A short stroll from the Old Customs House takes you to the Quartier des Tanneurs (the Tanners' Quarter). The aptly named quarter was where tanners created leather products. They would use upper floors of the houses to dry out the skins.
sources.shortName: 13 Top-Rated Tourist Attractions in Colmar

sources.snippet: Quartier des Tanneurs (Tanners‚Äô District) is another place that you absolutely have to see in Colmar. Located just a short walk from Little Venice, this area is just as picturesque.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Colmar, France (+Map & Tips for Your Visit)

places.name: Quartier des Tanneurs

reviews.text: Sunch a loveley place. Worth a day trip to Cmar
Pretty city during Christmas time. However, the weather was not ideal this time for the holidays. In addition, crowded place
Beautiful buildings in a charming neighborhood.

places.address: Pt Rue des Tanneurs, 68000 Colmar, France
